scene4_1: ^Lupe and Misra find themselves on the Main Street of Kettle Rock, in front of a Fountain.
^The General Store and Arcade are accessible.
^Any store marked with a closed sign is not accessible.

c-0: ^[Misra] Kettle Rock, Main Street. Heart of the Downtown.
^[Misra] There's bound to be some locals around - where do you want to start?
c-1: ^[Misra] Good luck getting anything out of them.
c-2: ^[Misra] Looks like the Bar is open! Shall we?
^[Lupe] I still need to drive back out tonight once the road is cleared.
^[Misra] I forgot to tell you, but the earliest I can get someone out there to clear the tree is tomorrow morning.
^[Misra] I know you had somewhere to be.
^[Lupe] But I suppose there's nothing you can do about it.
^[Misra] Think of it this way...we get more time to crack this case!
^[Misra] But in the meantime, let's take a bit of a break...

b: ^"The Heart of Kettle Rock" seems a bit...barren.

s1: ^ I don't think it's anything important.

b: ^[Misra] Hm. Looks like some sort of silly engravement.
^[Lupe] It was at the Gas Station near the edge of town.
^[Misra] Looks like the Bar is open! Shall we?
^[Lupe] I still need to drive back out tonight once the road is cleared.
^[Misra] I forgot to tell you, but the earliest I can get someone out there to clear the tree is tomorrow morning.
^[Misra] I know you had somewhere to be.
^[Lupe] But I suppose there's nothing you can do about it.
^[Misra] Think of it this way...we get more time to crack this case!
^[Misra] But in the meantime, let's take a bit of a break...
^[Misra] Someone wants a drink, I see.
^[Misra] The Rockin Kettle doesn't open until happy hour!

c-5: ^[Misra] I'm sorry if Roy seems like a bit of a downer.
^[Lupe] He seems like he's got a pretty good acceptance of the situation.
^[Misra] Well, you've only been here a day...
c-7: ^[Lupe] A lot of things seem to be closed...
c-11: ^[Misra] Usually it's busy and full of life,
^[Misra] but things have been bumpy for a lot of locals lately,
^[Misra] Not enough profit to keep them going.

s: ^Do you mind explaining this pamphlet a bit?

c-3: ^Lupe leans close to a pamphlet that has four pages detailing the town history.

c-1: ^[Roy_Rodgerson] Let me know if you need anything from me!

s0: ^Look, unless you want to talk about HOSI, we're done.

c-2: ^[Misra] Just so you know, these guys are a litte...
^[Lupe] I deal with intense people all the time.
^[Lupe] I'm not afraid of whoever is in there.

b: ^[Lupe] I don't recognize any of these games.
^[Misra] They're all knock offs of knock offs.

s0: ^Look, unless you want to talk about HOSI, we're done.

teens_roulette: ^Say I wanted to learn more about the Winery...anyone been talking about it lately?

c-3: ^[Misra] They've been trying to beat it for a while now.
^[Lupe] What does that have to do with anything?
^[Misra] It's the only game in here they don't have the high score on.
c-4: ^[Lupe] And I'm not the one blocking you from your high score.
^[Lupe] I wanted to learn a little more about the town.
^[Jenny] I can tell when someone's lying, you know.
c-5: ^[Lupe] Can you, uh, speak a little slower?
c-6: ^[Lupe] Hey man, can you turn that down a bit?
^[Josh] THAT SOUNDS LIKE A YOU PROBLEM.
^[Lupe] You must not have anything important to say, then.
^[Lupe] I can just talk to your friends, then.
^[Lupe] You probably don't matter as much, anyway.
^Josh turns down the music a bit.

teens_suspect: ^So. Anything else you wanna get off your chests?

c-3: ^[Jenny] Unless the Rookie Sheriff wants to conceit their HO:SI score, no.
^[Jenny] We're done talking with you losers.

scene4_4: ^Only accessible after Gen Store and Arcade have been visited

b: ^ Is that Ritam Misra I spy?

s0: ^Man, how much do you have to drink to be knocked out that bad?
s1: ^ That's gonna hurt when he comes to.

goop: ^[Lupe] You've been getting this stuff too, huh?
^ It's been coming up out of the drains like crazy.
^ It's annyoing, but it comes off easy enough.
^ I just dump all the bleach I've got in the backroom on it and poof!
memorial_plaque: ^Lupe leans close to a memorial plaque on the wall. It reads "In Memory of those lost in the Tragedy of 1940. Rest in Peace, Never Forgotten." Over the corner of it, someone has sharpied over it with "THOSE STUPID GOATS!"

first_interact_roy: ^[Misra] It's good to see you too, Uncle.
^ Meh. Not very good. But I am used to it by now.

c-0: ^ A Detective? What's this about, Misra?
^[Misra] We're just asking a few questions about a disturbance last night.
^ Of course, in anyway that I can.

c-3: ^ Feel free to look around, if it helps any.

window: ^[Lupe] You have a perfect view of the Winery from here.
^ It's not much to look at these days.
^[Lupe] Did you...see anything out of place, last night?
^[Misra] We're investigating a break in that happened.
^ Ay, Misra, you should not be poking around up there.
^[Lupe] Any ideas on who would want to break in and trash the place?
merch_shirt: ^[Lupe] Really leaning into that small town appeal, I see.
^ Believe it or not, those used to fly off the shelves.
^ I'd sell out of them one month, and then by the month after, I couldn't pay people to touch them.
merch_sticker: ^[Lupe] I feel like you'd need witchcraft to get these things to sell.

c-0: ^ Dios Mio; that was a hard time.
^ Although I'd argue that we've fallen on harder times now.
^[Misra] Come on Roy, don't say that!
^ So optimistic, and I love you for that.
^ The Rocky Years was a time of inconsistency.
^ We would flourish for the first part of the decade and struggle the latter.
^ Disease of an unexplained nature swept through town.
^ We couldn't link it to anything -
^ not spoiled food or contaminated water,
^ It was. I do not miss that time.
c-1: ^ Folk around here speak ill of them, but don't listen.
^ Certain people even like to gossip, call them names,
^ insinuate that there was something else going on.
^ Nothing real, and nothing worth talking about.
c-2: ^ Business was, as you say, booming.
^ The Winery sales were good, tourism was up.
^ people recovered from whatever mysterious disease had passed over us.
^ It was a good time, but it's over now.
^[Misra] For now. Good times will come again!
^ Sometimes that's not the case, mijo.
^ Sometimes, the good times are just behind us.

personal_info: ^ Well, I was born and raised here in Kettle Rock.
^ My sister was the last, in 1940.
^ Unless, of course, you count Misra.
^[Misra] When my parent's moved away, he became my guardian.
^ I begged and begged for Misra to leave, too.
town_history: ^ As I'm sure you've noticed, it's not in the best shape.
^ Lots of places shutting down, going out of business.
^ I think it's just unsustainable as it is.
^ I know you don't like to hear it, but it's the truth.
^ You stepped up as Sheriff once the rest of the force retired to take care of this place
^ but it seems to me like it might be time to move on.
^[Misra] Someone's got to try and turn things around.
winery_closing: ^ Ah, the straw that broke the camels back.
^ It finally shut down, about a month ago.
^ I have no idea what will become of it.
^ There are only so many things you can do with an old Winery.

b: ^ If I had to place blame,
^ If I had to pick someone...
^ I'd say those troublemakers down at the Arcade.

roy_teenagers: ^[Lupe] We spoke to the teens at Power Up.
^ Jenny still giving you a hard time?
^[Lupe] They denied having anything to do with the Winery.
^[Lupe] They did point us towards a "Jenkins Tomm".
^ I'm not sure he'll be any help to you.
^ Really, Misra, I think you two should leave this alone.
^[Misra] We've got to get to the bottom of this!

HOSI_questions2: ^ The invaders are the bad guys.
^ I don't like being a bad guy, so I'm the hamster.
personal_info_calvin: ^ My bedrooms on the second floor.
^ I used to go to school here, too, until Kettle Rock Junior High shut down.
^ I was in Mrs. Peterson's class.
^ I tried out for soccer but didn't make the team.
^[Lupe] That's ah, more than enough info.
^[Lupe] But uh, what was your name?
winery_calvin: ^ That place gives me the heebie-jeebies.
^ It's probably haunted or cursed or something.
^ Because it never could stay open.
^ It was always closed, open, bankrupt, making money, then losing money, on and on.
^ And the stupid Goats were always up there, too.

b: ^[Lupe] Someone said you maybe were up at the Winery?

KR_calvin: ^ Not much to do other than game and--

jenny_intro: ^[Lupe] I just want to ask you a few questions.
^[Misra] You're still mad about the HO:SI thing?

KR_Jenny: ^ Small ass town in the middle of nowhere.
^[Lupe] I noticed that there's not too many people around.
^ Yeah, all the sane people have moved away in the last few years.
^ My mom wants to leave, too,
^ but she isn't sure where we would go.
^ Eh. This town is full of crazies and people stuck in denial.
personal_info_jenny: ^[Lupe] What do you do for fun?
winery_jenny: ^[Lupe] It seemed kinda important, to like, the town
^ I mean, the stupid Goats sure liked it up there.

b: ^[Lupe] Someone told us that you guys like to hang around up there.
^[Lupe] You know, I have knack for when someone's not telling me the whole truth, too.
^ I've never set foot inside that place.
^[Lupe] Are you talking about the people who disappeared in 1940?
^ Mom tells me to not speak ill of the dead.

j_suspects: ^ Jenkins won't shut up about it.
^ Blah blah this, blah blah that.

KR_josh: ^ Everything's been closing, not like there was much to begin with.
^[Misra] It's okay, we'll get back on our feet.
winery_josh: ^[Lupe] What does that have to do with anything?

b: ^[Lupe] You wouldn't have happened to go up there recently?
^[Josh] THIS IS A REALLY GOOD SONG.

jo_suspects: ^ I'D SAY JENKINS, BUT HE'S PROBABLY TOO DRUNK TO TELL YOU ANYTHING.
jenkins_intro: ^[Irene] These folks have some questions for you.
^ I ain't got nothin to say to the Rookie Sheriff.
^[Irene] You answer their questions or I'm closing your tab.
^ The hell do you want to know?

s: ^You wouldn't have happened to be up there last night?
^That's the second time I've heard the word 'sacrifice' tossed around. Are you talking about the people who vanished? The ..Council?

c-0: ^ Will I ever stop hearing about the godforsaken place?
^ S'worth nothing but the dirt it stands on.
c-1: ^ S'was here last night, I was.
^[Lupe] You haven't been up there lately, then?
^ I'm reminded of 'em everytime I set foot in the building.
^ I feel like they can still hear them...
c-2: ^ All that blood sunk into this town.
^ All that blood turned into fleeting money.
^ Was it worth it, do you think?
c-3: ^ The Council was s'much more than that.
^ Their sacrifice s'not somethin to throw away,
^ They did what they did for us.
c-4: ^ They all thought she was right.
^ End of the line, ship s'goin down.
^ Rookie Sheriff, do you remember her?
^[Misra] I-I don't know who you're talking about.
c-5: ^ That's what this town slaps over the truth.
^[Lupe] We're starting to pick up some steam with this.
^[Misra] We've been questioning people all day.

Irene_intro: ^ Let me know if you need anything.

s: ^People have been mentioning goats a lot.
^Someone's drawn on your memorial plaque over there.
^How long have you lived in Kettle Rock?
^What do you know about the Old Winery?
^Despite all the closed shops and stores, this place is still open...

c-0: ^[Lupe] I get the feeling they're not talking about the animal.
^ Misra, you haven't filled them in on this?
^[Misra] I don't like talking about it.
^[Lupe] If it's important to the case, I should know.
^ The people who disappeared in the tragedy.
^ It's just silly town folklore meant to scare kids and give people a reason to gossip.
^ They call them "Goats" because people think they sacrificied themselves.
^ Like, you know, a sacrificial lamb.
c-1: ^ I'll clean it off when I close up.
c-2: ^ Who better to be interested in a small town mystery than a Detective?
^[Misra] That's not the case we're working on, though.
^ I'm sure Misra's told you about Kettle Rock's rocky past?
^ Well, legend says that in order to save the town, in desperation, a group of locals turned to darker alternatives.
^ I don't know if they were dancin' with the Devil,
^ or one of the many demons that want to sink their fangs into humanity's naviety,
^ but they were in kahoots with something of that nature.
^ And one day in 1940, when it came time to pay up and face the music...
^[Lupe] I feel like you've given that speech before
^ Hey, I gotta keep the drunks entertained somehow.
c-3: ^ I moved here when I was 13!
^ I actually when to highschool with Misra.
^ But I'm sure you know that already.
c-4: ^ Sheesh, that old shack on the hill?
^ More trouble than it's worth, in my opinion.
^[Misra] There was a break in, it looks like.
^[Misra] We're trying to find probable cause.
^ Heck, what are you talking to me for?
^ You should be talking to Jenkins over there.
^ Yeah, he's been taking it rough.
^ He worked at the place for years.
^[Lupe] Would he have any reason to go up there and trash the place?
^ Hell, I don't know. But I can tell you he's been here every night for the past week. Hasn't budged from his Whiskey Neat.
^ But why don't you ask him yourselves?
^ Give him a good shove, and he'll come to.
^ I've done it a dozen times when he passes out like this.
c-5: ^ It's a little concerning that the bar is one of
^ the businesses that is still able to stay afloat.
^ People need somewhere to forget about their troubles, I guess.
^ To be honest, I've been debating closing up shop myself.
^ Yeah; Roy offered to buy me out.
^ Says he'll pay me up front for the place, too.
^[Misra] Roy's trying to push you out?
^ I'm not the only person he's made this offer too.
^ He bought out the Diner, I'm pretty sure.
^[Misra] That's just hurting the town more.
